title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Always begin with the regular scoring guide. Try an alternate scoring guide only if necessary. (See I.D below.)

I. Regular Scoring Guide

A. Award 1 point for each segment correct in both pitch and rhythm.

· A “segment” is any half measure of the original melody (i.e. any set of two contiguous quarter-note beats), even if occurring over a bar line or beginning on a metrically weak pulse.

· To receive credit, a segment must not overlap with any other segment receiving credit.

· Do not subdivide a note to identify a segment.

· To receive credit, a segment may be metrically shifted from its original position.

· Give no credit for the final note if notation of pitches continues thereafter.

· The following notations will not receive credit: enharmonic equivalents; octave transpositions; dots before the notehead; accidentals after the notehead.

B. If at least one segment is correct in pitch and rhythm, award 1 additional point to the total. For example, a response that is correct in all aspects receives a score of 4 + 1 = 5. Exception: Do not award a 5 unless all measures have the correct number of beats. Award a 4 (i.e., do not award the additional point) to an otherwise perfect response that does not use bar lines correctly.

C. Record any score of 2 or higher and disregard the alternate scoring guides.

D. If after applying A–C the score is less than 2, try an alternate scoring guide.

E. If you try both regular and alternate scoring guides, award the higher of the scores if there is a difference.

F. For ease of scoring, the Alternate Scoring Guides have been accounted for in the point-value options presented. However, scores from the regular scoring guide may not be combined with those from an alternate scoring guide and vice versa.

II. Alternate Scoring Guides (Do not award the additional point to the total.)

A. Award ½ point per segment of correct pitches. (Maximum of 2 points)

OR

B. Award ¼ point per segment of correct rhythm. (Maximum of 1 point)

C. Rounding fractional scores:

· A total score of ½ rounds up to 1. A total score of 1½ rounds down to 1.

· Quarter points should be rounded to the closest integer.
descriptions:
No segments are correct in both pitch and rhythm [Regular Scoring].

OR

One segment is correct in rhythm [Alternate Scoring B].

No segments are correct in both pitch and rhythm. One to three segments are correct in pitch [Alternate Scoring A].

OR

No segments are correct in both pitch and rhythm. Two to four segments are correct in rhythm [Alternate Scoring B].

One segment is correct in both pitch and rhythm [Regular Scoring].

OR

No segments are correct in both pitch and rhythm. Four segments are correct in pitch [Alternate Scoring A].
Two segments are correct in both pitch and rhythm [Regular Scoring].
Three segments are correct in both pitch and rhythm [Regular Scoring].
Four segments are correct in both pitch and rhythm [Regular Scoring].
